nodes.title: 5 things to learn from the haze about changing climate change
nodes.content: If you have seen the news from Southeast Asia recently, you would know the haze is back again, impacting health, lives and livelihoods of thousands. Caused mainly by illegal slash and burn practices to clear land to meet the growing demand for pulp, paper and palm oil, the haze is widely regarded as an (almost) […]

nodes.title: NEA triggers the Transboundary Haze Pollution Act
nodes.content: Minister for the Environment Mr Vivian Balakrishnan has announced details on his Facebook account of the first companies to be served notice under the Transboundary Haze Pollution Act. The Minister also announced the government’s intentions to review its procurement procedure saying they would be taking measures to ensure where possible their suppliers followed internationally recognised […]

nodes.title: Should Your Child Wear a Haze Mask?
nodes.content: You might have seen us recently giving out N95 masks in the streets with the help of our campaign partners.
